Intercept only fits should be done setting `intercept = TRUE` and using `NULL` for the left side of the formula.

```{r setup}
library(lnmixsurv)
set.seed(2)
mod1 <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(y, delta) ~ NULL, sim_data$data, intercept = TRUE, show_output = FALSE)
mod1
```

The predictions can be made with a "empty" data.frame with one row.

```{r}
predict(mod1, new_data = data.frame(val = NA), type = "survival", eval_time = 100) |>
  tidyr::unnest(cols = .pred)
```
